jsanalyser

Class Parser

  • java.lang.Object
    • jsanalyser.Parser

  • public class Parser
extends java.lang.Object
    Parser class.

    This class is a state machine which will read a piece of code, chunk by . chunk (The code to parse can be in a single chunk).

    Depending the current parsed char and the machine's state, tokens, strings or regex will be stored in some according Analyser classes.

    The parser does not checks the syntax, it assumes the code is valid.

    The machine's state is an integer in which each bit is a specific state (in string, in regex, in comment...).

    Each possible state is stored in an attribute of the class. Those attributes' values are the rank of the bit they change in the global state.

    • Field Detail

      • IN_STRING

        protected final int IN_STRING
        State attribute. Associated with the bit to know if the parser's current char is in a string.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • ESCAPED_CHAR

        protected final int ESCAPED_CHAR
        State attribute. Associated with the bit to know if the parser is parsing an escaped character (which means the previous one was a '\').
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • STRING_START

        protected final int STRING_START
        State attribute. Associated with the bit to know if the parser enters a string. Which means the current parsed char is a simple or double quote.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • STRING_END

        protected final int STRING_END
        State attribute. Associated with the bit to know if the parser exits a string. Which means the current parsed char is a simple or double quote.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • MAYBE_START_COMMENT

        protected final int MAYBE_START_COMMENT
        State attribute. Associated with the bit to know if the parser enters a comment. Which means the current character is a '/'. This does not mean it's actually a comment, It will be one if the next character is a '/' or a '*'.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • MAYBE_END_BLOCK_COMMENT

        protected final int MAYBE_END_BLOCK_COMMENT
        State attribute. Associated with the bit to know if the parser reaches the end of a comment. Which means the parser is in a bloc comment and the current char is a '*'.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • IN_INLINE_COMMENT

        protected final int IN_INLINE_COMMENT
        State attribute. Associated with the bit to know if the parser is currently parsing an inline comment (which started with "//"). This state is set back to 0 at the next line ending.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • IN_BLOCK_COMMENT

        protected final int IN_BLOCK_COMMENT
        State attribute. Associated with the bit to know if the parser is currently parsing a block comment (which started with "/*"). This state is set back to 0 at the next "*\/".
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • END_BLOCK_COMMENT

        protected final int END_BLOCK_COMMENT
        State attribute. Associated with the bit to know if the parser reached the end of a block comment. Which means the current char is a '/' and the previous one was a '*'.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • IN_NUMERIC

        protected final int IN_NUMERIC
        State attribute. Associated with the bit to know if the parser is currently parsing a numeric value, not in a comment, nor in a string neither in a regex.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • IN_TOKEN

        protected final int IN_TOKEN
        State attribute. Associated with the bit to know if the parser is currently parsing a token. A token can be a keyword, a method/function name, an attribute or a variable.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • MAYBE_IN_REGEX

        protected final int MAYBE_IN_REGEX
        State attribute. Associated with the bit to know if the parser enters a regex. Which means the current char is a '/' and the parser is not in a string neither in a comment and that the parser is not exiting a token or a numeric (in which case, the '/' would be a division. This does not mean it will actually be a regex, this will be confirmed if the next char is not a '/', nor a '*', neither a '(' (in which cases, it would be an inline comment, a bloc comment or a division).
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • IN_REGEX

        protected final int IN_REGEX
        State attribute. Associated with the bit to know if the parser is currently parsing a regex.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • IN_REGEX_END

        protected final int IN_REGEX_END
        State attribute. Associated with the bit to know if the parser is currently parsing the options of a regex (after the ending '/').
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • END_PARENTHESIS

        protected final int END_PARENTHESIS
        State attribute. Associated with the bit to know if the parser is on a closing parenthesis, but not in a regex, nor in a comment neither in a string.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • strings

        protected StringAnalyser strings
        Analyser for the strings in the parsed code. All the detected strings will be stored in this attribute, to be then analysed.

      • currentString

        protected java.lang.String currentString
        Current parsed string. Reinitialised to "" at the beginning of the next string.

      • currentStringDelimiter

        protected char currentStringDelimiter
        Can be '\'' or '"'. To know when the current string will end.

      • numerics

        protected NumericAnalyser numerics
        Analyser for the numeric values in the parsed code. All the detected numeric values will be stored in this attribute, to be then analysed.

      • currentNumeric

        protected java.lang.String currentNumeric
        Current parsed numeric value. Reinitialised to "" at the beginning of the next numeric.

      • regexes

        protected RegexAnalyser regexes
        Analyser for the regexes in the parsed code. All the detected regexes will be stored in this attribute, to be then analysed.

      • currentRegex

        protected java.lang.String currentRegex
        Current parsed regex. Reinitialised to "" at the beginning of the next regex.

      • tokens

        protected TokenAnalyser tokens
        Analyser for the tokens in the parsed code. All the detected tokens will be stored in this attribute, to be then analysed.

      • currentToken

        protected java.lang.String currentToken
        Current parsed token. Reinitialised to "" at the beginning of the next token.

      • currentCharIndex

        protected int currentCharIndex
        Index of the current parsed char in the code to analyse. Not used yet.

      • state

        protected int state
        Current global state of the parser. Composition of different states bits.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Parser

        public Parser()

    • Method Detail

      • reset

        protected void reset()
        Reset the parser with the default values.

        The analysers are reconstructed and the state and index of the current character are set to 0.

      • parseCodeChunk

        public void parseCodeChunk(java.lang.String chunk)
        This method loops on each characters of a code chunk and will parse it.
        Parameters:
        chunk - The chunk of code to parse. A chunk can be a subpart of a whole code, so does not need to be valid by itself.

      • parseChar

        protected void parseChar(char c)
        Method to parse the current character.

        The parser is completely agnostic of the neighbour characters and analyse the current one only based on the current state.

        First, the parser will parse the comments, regex and strings states. Those processes are supposed to be interchangeable. Then if the current char is not in one of those 3 states, the numerics and tokens will be parsed.

        Parameters:
        c - The character to parse.

      • printReport

        public void printReport()
        Print the analyse's report.

        Each analyser print their report, to know which elements are optimisable.

      • compareState

        protected boolean compareState(int flag)
        Compares the global state with a given flag.
        Parameters:
        flag - The flag to test
        Returns:
        true if the flag is set to 1 in the global state.

      • enableState

        protected void enableState(int flag)
        Sets a flag's bit to 1 in the global state.
        Parameters:
        flag - The flag to activate.

      • disableState

        protected void disableState(int flag)
        Sets a flag's bit to 0 in the global state.
        Parameters:
        flag - The flag to desactivate.

      • inComment

        protected boolean inComment()
        Returns:
        true if the parser is currently in a comment.

      • inRegex

        protected boolean inRegex()
        Returns:
        true if the parser is currently in a regex.

      • inString

        protected boolean inString()
        Returns:
        true if the parser is currently in a string.

      • parseRegex

        protected void parseRegex(char c)
        This method parses a regex. It will detect if the parser enters or exits a regex. At the end of a regex, the parsed regex will be stored in the regex analyser (RegexAnalyser.
        Parameters:
        c - The current character.

      • parseComments

        protected void parseComments(char c)
        This method parses a comment. It will detect if the parser enters or exits a comment.

        For the moment, comments are ignored in the analyse.

        Parameters:
        c - The current character.

      • parseNumeric

        protected void parseNumeric(char c)
        This method parses a numeric value. It will detect if the parser enters or exits a numeric value. At the end of a numeric, the parsed numeric will be stored in the numeric analyser (NumericAnalyser.
        Parameters:
        c - The current character.

      • parseString

        protected void parseString(char c)
        This method parses a string. It will detect if the parser enters or exits a string. At the end of a string, the parsed string will be stored in the string analyser (StringAnalyser.
        Parameters:
        c - The current character.

      • parseToken

        protected void parseToken(char c)
        This method parses a token. It will detect if the parser enters or exits a token. At the end of a token, the parsed token will be stored in the token analyser (TokenAnalyser.
        Parameters:
        c - The current character.
